source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Cunoniaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Cunoniaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Flowers distinctly pedicellate; leaves usually serrate; petals pink or white; fruit a several-seeded capsule; widespread in southern Victoria
Flowers sessile in axils; leaves usually entire; petals bright magenta; fruit usually 1-seeded, nut-like; Grampians only
